abstract.p: Ellen E Nevins letter says photograph of Gov Christine Todd Whitman of New Jersey frisking a suspected criminal (July 11) is unfortunate but is by no means an accurate portrayal of her behavior toward minority groups

block.p: The photograph of Gov. Christine Todd Whitman of New Jersey frisking a suspected criminal is unfortunate (front page, July 11), but it is by no means an accurate portrayal of her behavior toward minority groups.

As governor, Mrs. Whitman has included qualified minority-group members in her cabinet. As someone actively involved with the work of the Community Foundation of New Jersey, she has tried to bring new community-development programs to urban areas of New Jersey. She has also worked with the Neighborhood Leadership Initiative, a program she helped create that is intended to identify and train minority-group members who have had some leadership experience in their own communities.

The photograph of Gov. Christine Todd Whitman of New Jersey frisking a suspected criminal is unfortunate (front page, July 11), but it is by no means an accurate portrayal of her behavior toward minority groups.

As governor, Mrs. Whitman has included qualified minority-group members in her cabinet. As someone actively involved with the work of the Community Foundation of New Jersey, she has tried to bring new community-development programs to urban areas of New Jersey. She has also worked with the Neighborhood Leadership Initiative, a program she helped create that is intended to identify and train minority-group members who have had some leadership experience in their own communities.

Over all, she has done a great deal to promote better conditions and greater opportunities for minority groups throughout the state. This should be borne in mind when considering the implications of the photograph.
ELLEN E. NEVINS Belle Mead, N.J., July 12, 2000
